pros: From the President down to the grounds crew, all staff are very kind and helpful. This is the best place I have ever worked.
cons: None. This is a super place to serve our youth.

review_title: 0 our of 5 stars, Do not recommend - RUN
pros: Beautiful campus, a handful of nice people, pretty horses.
cons: I have never worked in such a negative, unprofessional environment in my life. Regardless if you are a higher education staffer or an academic for life, you should walk away. If you need a place to get started, you will learn a ton about how NOT to run a university. There is no integrity here. Student services are seen as cost savings and are cut right and left. Athletic programs grow and grow because it is the only way they can attract students. A constant rotating door for faculty and staff.

review_title: Leadership likes a small table and isn't interested in new ideas
pros: Beautiful environment and nice colleagues at Director level or below. Ability for upward mobility (unless you become someone targeted for blame from above).
cons: Top leadership isn't interested in positive changes. They make the table smaller around them and always have a "fall guy." All growth is centered on athletics and not academics. Environment is "you're in or you're out." Almost no one leaves here on good terms.

pros: Small classes, Small campus, nice environment.

Excellent guidance 
Incredible mission 
Caring administration
cons:
Travel can be extensive 
Limited opportunity

pros: easy to use and jobs are updated normally
cons: sends to many update emails daily

pros: There should be a lot of potential here for a young person to get good experience and develop their career. The university seems to be trying to find strategies to survive in difficult times for private colleges. Most of the students are truly wonderful, hardworking, thoughtful young people.
cons:
Everyone at Midway is a Director or higher. There are very few positions that aren't labeled as Director. The title is a joke, though, because no one has a staff. If you are unfortunate enough to be one of the few non-director employees, you will have an unbelievable workload.

The management is completely top-down. Do not even dream of making a suggestion. My Director will not let me speak to anyone but her to make sure that I don't try to handle anything myself.

There is very little true support for the mission of the university. A lot of lip service is paid to the importance of teaching, but teachers are hired hours before classes begin (and sometime after they begin). There is no training for them. Each 'department' consists of one or two full time faculty and an armada of ever-changing adjuncts. The school simply doesn't have the critical mass of faculty to survive long term. Don't think getting hired is a complement. If you applied and you are breathing, you'll get hired.

The highest level administration has their ideas about what need to be done and they are completely isolated from the realities of the day to day work, so those ideas are completely irrelevant, but they won't hear any other ideas.

Despite a very top heavy structure, tThe university continues to suffer from lack of leadership that truly understands or is willing to act on the issues. The university continues to suffer from a serious identity crisis--failing to recognize its own strengths (online learning) and weaknesses (lack of skilled employees). Good employees don't last long in this environment. Most employees at Midway have been there less than 2 years (many less than 6 months).

pros: I enjoyed the employees and the beautiful landscape.
cons: Communication, authoritarian leadership, and high turnover are the most serious issues.

review_title: It seemed so good at first...
pros: Great scenery, nice people, good students, beautiful campus. Genuinely welcoming and professional instructors.
cons: Lower pay than average, long hours, authoritarian leadership style, poor communication between departments, all combine to create a toxic work environment if you're not at the top levels of the school. Seriously: managers and supervisors are the real problem here. They don't communicate clearly, then blame their employees for not reading their minds. They don't encourage cooperation between the departments, which leads to infighting between otherwise decent people.

pros: The only pro I can think on is the fact that you can make a little extra money for a while. You cannot live on their salaries.
cons: Lowest salary in the area. Terribly demanding for the money. Disrespectful and arrogant personnel. Do not work for them. Seriously...
